name: places/ChIJt2_NNJRYwokRW5pZNquWgYk

displayName.text: Robert A. Aldoroty, MD, PhD, PLLC

adrFormatAddress: 1974 1st Ave., New York, NY 10029-6430, USA

originalText.text: I was fortunate enough to have had Dr. Aldoroty as my surgeon on two separate occasions. The first surgery was a Lower Anterior Resection in 2015. The second was for Hernia Surgery just 12 days ago. On both occasions Dr. Aldoroty provided the best of care and support both pre and post surgery. I cannot express the importance of selecting a medical profession who maintains a vested interest in his patients, to ensure the best opportunity for a successful procedure and full recovery. Based on my personal experience I highly recommend Dr. Aldoroty and his staff.

originalText.text: Since my hernia surgery in August 2021 I have been miserable. I reported my problems to Dr. Aldoroty and found him to be very dismissive. In addition he never scheduled me for a post surgical visit which is unheard of. Stay away.

text.text: Since my hernia surgery in August 2021 I have been miserable. I reported my problems to Dr. Aldoroty and found him to be very dismissive. In addition he never scheduled me for a post surgical visit which is unheard of. Stay away.

originalText.text: ABYSMAL--The last remark,( that instilled a total lack of confidence in this person) that I was given by this person was "I don't know why the incisions I made are not healing"  this was after approximately 11 months since the initial surgery and another follow up admission to the hospital to resolve the "-but they appear to be open wounds and even  with the frequent office visits during these many months there has been no improvement" With this revelation-that I was in the care of a doctor who REALLY DID NOT KNOW-I went to a highly skilled professional ,an obvious expert in his field and someone who did "have the answers" This procedure was healed in approximately one month and this is after the Doctor rectified the  lack of knowledge which created the problem the original -who had no clue as to what was occurring- this "dr" had left sutures in my incisions and could not identify the concomitant infection they caused-
